rationale: Includes daily dosing and 0.02 mg EE / 0.1 mg LNG but as two separate drugs and even cites YAZ (drospirenone); omits “start tonight” and 28-day pack wording.
Lists 6-month supply but no Harbor Pharmacy queue, voucher, Form K, or fax logistics.
Missed-pill instructions (<12 h vs >12 h and 7-day condoms) clearly documented.
No mention of common side-effects or serious warning signs.
Gives phone-alarm adherence tip but omits spotting guidance and ibuprofen advice.
Patient concerns about timing, bleeding, costs not captured.
No reflection of age, existing dysmenorrhea/irregular menses, or current meds.
Several key clinician elements absent; structure minimal.
Introduces YAZ and separate LNG prescription not in transcript—moderate fabrication.
Hormone combination recorded inaccurately; extra tablet counts; therefore notable numeric errors.
Does not dump unrelated chart data.
Omission of side-effects, warning signs, logistics → significant gaps.
